701128f-a.title: Bronx: Grand Concourse - 149th Street (East)
701128f-a.text:
571 to 555 Grand Concourse, north of, adjoining, and at the N. W. corner of E. 149th Street, showing several buildings that were later demolished when the thoroughfare
was widened.
May 16, 1928
P. L. Sperr

701132f-a.title: Bronx: Grand Concourse - 149th Street (East)
701132f-a.text:
Grand Concourse, east side, north from (No. 472) and across E. 149th Street. Shown, under constructfon, at E. 149th
Street is a new United States Post Office.
July 7, 1936
P. L. Sperr

701131f-a.title: Bronx: Grand Concourse - 149th Street (East)
701131f-a.text:
Grand Concourse, north from E. 149th Street, showing the thoroughfare being widened on the west side. A number of old tenements were razed and several taxpayers were erected on the new zoning line. In the background is the Bronx County Court House.
June 9, 1940
P. L. Sperr

701130f-a.title: Bronx: Grand Concourse - 149th Street
701130f-a.text:
1. Grand Concourse from 149h St.
Neg. A-148  April 30, 1941
P.L. Sperr, photographer
2. 149 St. & Grand Concourse, n.w. cor.
Neg. A-268  April 30, 1941
P.L. Sperr, photographer
